attraction_reviewComments: We hired bikes and rode over the bridge. It was not difficult as there was little wind that day. Great views of the city and Alcatraz and easy rise on to Sausalito. Something not... read more
Probably the most recognizable bridge in the world, the burnt orange hue in unmistakable. Built in the 1930's, it was marvel of technology and foresight. Awesome photos for the... read more
Don't leave without going over the Golden Gate bride either by car or bike . If you decide to bike make sure you are in fairly decent shape it is a jaunt especially with the wind

No trip to San Fran is complete without at least a drive by the iconic Golden Gate Bridge! The vibrant red colour against the beautiful blue ocean makes for great photos! Best... read more
Enjoyed the tour and displays at the Golden gate Bridge. Also the walk on the bridge was awesome. It's a wonderful experience.
You've seen it in so many photos, but to experience this in person is just phenomenal. The views both from it and of it are spectacular.
We stayed in SF for a few days on our way driving through the US. And if you're in SF, you know you can't miss seeing the Golden Gate Bridge. But be aware and not dissapointed... read more
We took the Big Bus tour over the bridge and whilst there's not too much to write about it, the views are stunning and it's just a must see.
I cannot recommend biking the bridge enough! We rented a tandem bike through Blazing Saddles and had an amazing time! The staff at Blazing Saddles is PHENOMENAL - they explain... read more

The attraction GOLDEN GATe is a key highlight in San francisco.The view of the bay and the walk on the bridge is truely mesmerising I recomment who ever visits the Baya rea... read more
If you walk the bridge one way, well you have to walk it back....yes we did it both ways. Again if you like to walk, this is a must for a anyone visiting San Fran.

As first time visitors, we were in awe of the beauty of the Golden Gate Bridge and surrounding area. Views from Twin Peaks are breathtaking!
Golden place to be. Best time to visit is summer, in winter it gets cold. It has got couple of vista points don't miss to stop at the sunset point(highest elevation).

Golden Gate bridge is obviously a must see when in San Fran. You may think "Oh, it's just a bridge", but its honestly hypnotizingly beautiful to look at. Don't miss this!
There is a spot once you cross away from SF where the old military base overlook used to be and the views from there are amazing. make sure to bring a panoramic camera. You can... read more
You need to walk across the bridge, what we found the best was to catch a Taxi to the other side and walk back across. The day was crystal clear, took at least an hour as a... read more
Although there is nothing to do at the Golden Gate Bridge other than fantastic photo opportunities it is definately worth a visit. People do not realise the vast size of it and we... read more

Best to go when early...the bridge was covered with fog but still enjoyed it..If driving get off right before the bridge exit..Great pictures
Rented bikes at Blazing Saddles Fisherman's Wharf. Beautiful, scenic ride to the bridge. Its busy and crowded at times, but that's because its the Golden Gate Bridge.

We started calling it the Magic Bridge because it just disappears suddenly (in the fog). We found free parking and walked across the bridge. Views are spectacular, and the fog... read more
We walked across during the “Fleet Week” celebrations. Great view of the bay and City areas and made for great “seats” during the aerial demonstrations. It’s a 3mile round-trip so... read more
Our family in San Francisco prodded us to try the bridge at night. Perhaps, we were lucky because the fog lifted and the moon was out. The breeze was chilly. The view was just... read more
Nothing I can say here which hasn't already been said. For the best views, head up the hill in the Golden Gate Recreational Area - turn left just after crossing the bridge from... read more
We were very lucky to visit the Bridge on a clear crisp day - the views were great! We got there on a No.28 bus from Fort Mason - much more economical that many of the 'tours' on... read more
Try a bike ride across this Bridge. Lots of bike rentals around to bike across it. It is louder than you'd think. Lots of cars and trucks but the views are awesome.
Rented bikes from Fisherman's Wharf and biked to the Bridge...beautiful!
The bridge is gorgeous, the views are gorgeous. I happened to go during an Indian Summer in the bay area so there was hardly any fog obscuring our views. It was such a wonderful... read more
We were on the bridge when the Blue Angels came screaming over for their arrival maneuvers. Too Cool. To me the bridge is always beautiful no matter the weather. In the fog... read more
If you don't do anything else, one must get the perspective of San Francisco from the Golden Gate Bridge. It's only a little over a mile long. Bring a coat!
The views from the bridge are wonderful. It was easy to bet to by bus and there is a visitors rest stop on the other side for a snack and/or bathroom stop.
A sight to see. I feel really lucky to have seen such beautiful views on a gorgeous clear day.
Golden Gate Bridge is a magnificent view from a distance, but to really experience the bridge you have to walk it (or use a bike). It's a long walk so I would recommend you to... read more
The history of it's name and the construction process are all interesting. How can you go to SanFran and not cross the Golden Gate??!!!
great view and great photos, get there early to beat the crowds of tourists though
It's worth both driving and walking. Just park your car in the parking lot (don't miss the sign to turn right before getting on the bridge) and don't forget your camera.
Guys there are a couple of vantage points either side of the bridge for the best views and photos. Settle in for sunset.....

My daughter and I biked across the bridge and took the ferry back from Sausalito- terrific! Wonderful views and manageable ride.

Great View! If you're a history fan, you may love it here. But, for first timers to the city, it's best to have your photo taken here!

Very scenic, free to drive across, Sausalito is very nice once you're on the other side.

this great for cycling or gogo cars, vista point is always busy around noon likely due to other people trying to commute
Very good views and landscapes... A very good experience to walk over the bridge and take a look at the city
great way to see the bridge and photos is to walk over it. I was nippy so bring gloves and a hat!

Something you have to do while you're in SF. You can also ride your bike over the bridge, but consider the weather first :-).

Loved the double decker tour to the bridge lookout - great, entertaining driver. Beautiful view. Not much not to like - not so sure that those riding upstairs would agree - it can... read more
Drived through the bridge. It's really magnificent, both in daytime and night. Bike tour is also recommended if you have good physical strength.
Any visit to San Francisco is not complete unless you have driven or better yet walked or bicycled across the Golden Gate Bridge.
It's probably one highlight of the city; but closed at night
This is one of the most beautiful "landscapes" in the world. Be sure to walk or do a bike ride. Hit Hendrik Point after you've crossed the bridge. BEAUTIFUL.

It is an amazing engineering accomplishment given the time it was built. The views both on the bridge and around the bridge are unsurpassed.
The bridge is a West Coast California icon linking San Francisco and Marin. On a clear day you can see for miles.
Great pictures and if you have time walk across. It gets chilly and windy.
Just amazing. Fortunetelly i went there on a very shiny day, not to crowded and i didn't wanna leave!
I liked the view from the bridge. Areas around the bridge ere quite lovely.
The Golden Gate Bridge is absolutely beautiful. If you ever visit San Francisco you must go on the Bridge and also go on the Ferry that takes you under the Bridge.

Great site to see....great land mark...just watch out for the bikers
We walked to the middle of the bridge in April. It was really windy. Bring a warm windproof jacket with you.
We walked the bridge on a foggy day. We were there the day before and it was perfect sunshine... Walking the bridge was exciting as we would hear the fog horns sound and ships... read more
Iconic bridge and a great start for you travels into the wine country
unbelievable views of the city and the bay area. Friends with car, other wise hard to reach. Could do it in a tour bus.
I love the view from land. Absolutely beautiful on a sunny day.
It's just one of those things that you have to do when in S.F. The day we went was quite foggy but still great none-the-less
So beautiful to see. I hate driving across bridges, but really liked seeing the Golden Gate Bridge in person. I might even brave crossing it one day!
Had a great day riding across the bridge! Incredible views, great information from the tour guide.
The mist on the bridge is ethereal. It has a special energy, and perhaps just knowing that I was on my way to Muir Woods made it all seem very wonderful and magical.
Beautful! Make great pictures and i like crossing is. Drove the outskirts of is to take pictues from a distance. I just enjoy this city each time we go and will always come... read more
It's just a bridge but its very nice, with very good views along the way
The stand-out icon of the SF Bay Area. One end in the City of SF - the other the foothils of Marin.
A must see for anyone that travels through the city. Both fog and sun make for a beautiful sight, or drive over.
WOW! I had only seen in movies and pictures, but the first hand view is not to be missed. If you have time and energy try walking across for the full experience. Be careful if... read more
Amazing view, amazing structure, had a great bus tour that took us there and also did a boat tour under the bridge. Amazing.
I never get tired of seeing it or driving across it. Beautiful view from both sides of the span.
First image was in 1970 when first moved to CA. Crossed bridge many times since then. A memorable experience each time. Location with view of ocean is spectacular.
nice place to visis san francisco great weather friendly people ,lots to do
Seeing the Golden Gate Bridge in person is an incredible experience. I recommend the view from the North side in Golden Gate state park.
the bridge is amazing at sunset. My husband and I visited before we went to Sausalito for dinner. Beautiful man made work
Try to walk it, run it, or at least drive it while you are in San Francisco.
Iconic, beautiful, & very high (if you have a fear of heights).
If you're in town don't pass up a chance to drive over this iconic American Landmark. Golden Gate is a toll bridge, if you are coming into town (southbound). worth every penny... read more
We went accross on a very cold, windy day and the views were breathtaking. Worth the effort to walk at least part-way accross.
This is a place to see! It was fun to drive across it and stand in the wind and take pics from different angles of the bridge.
Afraid of heights? Well, don't be for the five or so minutes it takes you to drive across this amazing suspension bridge. When you are in San Franciso read all about the bridge... read more

Drove over the bridge on the way to Napa valley. Amazing ride. On another day walked to it from the parking lot nearby to get some awesome pics.

Whether walking across, cycling, bus or car - it is a must.

You can walk across the bridge, bike it or drive across the bridge. The view from the other side is beautiful. There is a toll to pay when returning back to SF but no toll when... read more
It is worth the time and effort to visit and see the Golden Gate Bridge. The view of the bridge with the city as the back drop is great. The parks right at the bridge seem to... read more
If you go to San Francisco, you must drive across the famous Golden Gate Bridge. The views are priceless.
So much of what is attractive about the bridge is the "natural" part, the atmosphere that surrounds it. I love it when there's some mist and a chill in the air. Good thing that's... read more
Must Drive, Walk or Bike on that Bridge! you have seen bridge associate it with San Fran everywhere you go. therefore do not miss being on it when you are there.

Well worth a trip out on one of the bay cruises. Very relaxing and takes you out under the bridge. cheap too.

The symbol of San Francisco is a must do activity. We drove it and visited it on both ends. It is a wonderful backdrop for pictures from all directions. The engineering alone... read more

Try stopping in the parking areas at both sides of the bridge just before the sun sets to get fabulous views of the bridge- remember a tripod for best results
wowwww...no matter whatever i say about this place , it would be less...the bridge seems dazzling when the sun rays falls on it...bet sunset point ever seen :-)
Nice walk beware of inconsiderate cyclists who go whizzing by

always a great experience to get some bigger and fresher view
Took a trip over on an ope top bus,very cold and windy but well worth it the sights are amazing.
It was interesting to hear from our tour guide the facts of the bridge and how many people actually jump off it per year

This is by far the best part of San Fran. we went this weekend and it was beautiful!! clear, warm, honestly breath taking. i love the golden gate bridge

enrich_metadata.label: Berkeley, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Berkeley, Alameda County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Berkeley (/ˈbɜːrkliː/ BURK-lee) is a city on the east shore of San Francisco Bay in northern Alameda County, California. It is named after the 18th-century Anglo-Irish bishop and philosopher George Berkeley. It borders the cities of Oakland and Emeryville to the south and the city of Albany and unincorporated community of Kensington to the north. Its eastern border with Contra Costa County generally follows the ridge of the Berkeley Hills. Its population at the 2010 census was 112,580. Berkeley is the site of the oldest campus in the University of California system – the University of California, Berkeley – of the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory which is managed and operated by the university, and the Graduate Theological Union. It is one of the most politically liberal cities in the United States.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Berkeley,_California
enrich_metadata.comment: Berkeley (/ˈbɜːrkliː/ BURK-lee) is a city on the east shore of San Francisco Bay in northern Alameda County, California. It is named after the 18th-century Anglo-Irish bishop and philosopher George Berkeley. It borders the cities of Oakland and Emeryville to the south and the city of Albany and unincorporated community of Kensington to the north. Its eastern border with Contra Costa County generally follows the ridge of the Berkeley Hills. Its population at the 2010 census was 112,580.

enrich_metadata.label: San Francisco
enrich_metadata.abstract: San Francisco (/sæn frənˈsɪskoʊ/), officially the City and County of San Francisco, is the cultural, commercial, and financial center of Northern California and the only consolidated city-county in California. San Francisco encompasses a land area of about 46.9 square miles (121 km2) on the northern end of the San Francisco Peninsula, which makes it the smallest county in the state. It has a density of about 18,187 people per square mile (7,022 people per km2), making it the most densely settled large city (population greater than 200,000) in the state of California and the second-most densely populated major city in the United States after New York City. San Francisco is the fourth-most populous city in California, after Los Angeles, San Diego and San Jose, and the 13th-most populous city in the United States—with a Census-estimated 2014 population of 852,469. The city and its surrounding areas are known as the San Francisco Bay Area, and are a part of the larger OMB designated San Jose-San Francisco-Oakland combined statistical area, the fifth most populous in the nation with an estimated population of 8.6 million. San Francisco (Spanish for Saint Francis) was founded on June 29, 1776, when colonists from Spain established Presidio of San Francisco at the Golden Gate and Mission San Francisco de Asís named for St. Francis of Assisi a few miles away. The California Gold Rush of 1849 brought rapid growth, making it the largest city on the West Coast at the time. San Francisco became a consolidated city-county in 1856.After three-quarters of the city was destroyed by the 1906 earthquake and fire, San Francisco was quickly rebuilt, hosting the Panama-Pacific International Exposition nine years later. In World War II, San Francisco was the port of embarkation for service members shipping out to the Pacific Theater. After the war, the confluence of returning servicemen, massive immigration, liberalizing attitudes, along with the rise of the "hippie" counterculture, the Sexual Revolution, the Peace Movement growing from opposition to United States involvement in the Vietnam War, and other factors led to the Summer of Love and the gay rights movement, cementing San Francisco as a center of liberal activism in the United States. Politically, the city votes strongly along liberal Democratic Party lines. San Francisco is a popular tourist destination, known for its cool summers, fog, steep rolling hills, eclectic mix of architecture, and landmarks including the Golden Gate Bridge, cable cars, the former Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary, Fisherman's Wharf, and its Chinatown district. San Francisco is also the headquarters of five major banking institutions and various other companies such as Levi Strauss & Co., Gap Inc., Salesforce.com, Dropbox, Reddit, Square, Inc., Dolby, Airbnb, Weebly, Pacific Gas and Electric Company, Yelp, Pinterest, Twitter, Uber, Mozilla, Wikimedia Foundation, and Craigslist. It has several nicknames, including "The City by the Bay", "Fog City", "San Fran", and "Frisco", as well as older ones like "The City that Knows How", "Baghdad by the Bay", and "The Paris of the West". As of 2015, San Francisco was ranked high on world livability rankings.
